main_definition: To be the property of or to have a rightful ownership of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fit in with a particular group, culture, or category.
meanings_and_examples.example: A Japanese car would not belong in an American showroom.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be the property of someone and legally owned by them.
meanings_and_examples.example: That watch doesn't belong to me; it belongs to my sister.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have a part in or contribute to something, usually as an integral element or member.
meanings_and_examples.example: The flowers don't just belong in the garden; they are essential for its beauty.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To feel emotionally attached or connected to someone/something.
meanings_and_examples.example: I do not believe that my feelings of love belong only to humans.
